intro: Ruellia hispidosa, commonly known as hairy ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its foliage is often covered in fine, stiff hairs, which give it its common name. Ruellia hispidosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive blooms and adaptability to various garden conditions.
